Data: 9.20am: The coin has been tossed - and Darren Sammy has won it (for the first time in 10 attempts, no less). He's decided West Indies will have a bowl, perhaps influenced by the conditions. I'm presuming he has not based his decision on the success of his team's chasing a
9.55am: The covers are coming off! The start has been rescheduled for 10.15am, with a full 50-over schedule to come. Plenty of time for you to set up the steel drums.
Right, the players are out, under an overcast sky, and we're about to start. Kemar Roach will take the first new ball ...
Roach to Watson, 2 runs short, pulled into the ground behind square leg and Watson's off the mark first ball
Roach to Watson, no run bouncer, flies through as the batsman ducks
Roach to Watson, no run length, on off and defended down the wicket
Roach to Watson, no run short, attacking the batsman's body, dropped into the on side
Roach to Watson, no run length, seaming in and taking a chunk of bat before hitting the pad and rolling to midwicket
Roach to Watson, no run length ball outside off and Watson's shoulders arms
Bravo to Warner, no run full, swinging in a touch and driven to mid-off
Bravo to Warner, no run full again, swinging in before seaming a touch, beating Warner's attempted glance. Very close that
Bravo to Warner, no run length, pushed towards cover
Bravo to Warner, 1 run angled across and driven wide of the cover fielder
Bravo to Watson, 2 runs slightly full, on off and punched through the leg side
Bravo to Watson, no run length, prodded into the on side
Roach to Warner, no run short, Warner goes back on his toes and cuts to the man at point
Roach to Warner, no run thumps into Warner's pad as he chopped down on the ball - but it pitched outside leg
Roach to Warner, no run slanted across and dabbed to point again
Roach to Warner, no run length and beats the outside edge, Warner slashing like a horror movie bad guy
Roach to Warner, no run on the legs and nudged square to the fielder
Roach to Warner, no run short, hooked off his hips, again to the fielder, who tries to throw down the non-striker's end
Bravo to Watson, 1 run bit of width and Watson leans into a lazy, picture-perfect cover drive to the sweeper on the boundary
Bravo to Warner, 2 runs leg-stump line, tucked up but manages to squeeze the ball between square leg and midwicket for a couple
Bravo to Warner, 2 runs full, driven in the air, just dying on the fielder, Johnson Charles, as he dived for what would have been a spectacular catch
Bravo to Warner, FOUR runs short and hooked powerfully over midwicket - a sign of attacking intent from Warner
Bravo to Warner, no run length, outside off and angling across, driven on the bounce to cover-point
Bravo to Warner, no run defended into the off side
Roach to Watson, no run length, on the stumps, defended
Roach to Watson, 1 run bit of room outside off and driven through a gap in the covers
Roach to Warner, 1 run length, cut behind square
Roach to Watson, no run angled in from wide of the stumps, defended on the front foot
Roach to Watson, no run defended on the stumps
Roach to Watson, no run defended to third man, an aborted run nearly has Watson in trouble
Bravo to Warner, no run length, tight off-stump line, defended
Bravo to Warner, 3 runs full, driven square and a misfield sees the ball slip through at point before being reined in near the boundary
Bravo to Watson, no run good length, outside off and driven to cover where Sammy catches on the bounce
Bravo to Watson, no run outside off, prodded to cover again
Bravo to Watson, no run angled in, seaming a touch and chopped back to the bowler with Watson coming forward
Bravo to Watson, no run forward defensive back to the bowler
Roach to Warner, no run defended on the stumps

Roach to Warner, OUT bowled him! The delivery was back of a length but shot through low, clipping Warner's pad as he tried to play back before rattling into the stumps halfway up. The batsman was done by the bounce (or lack thereof) - but he had already misjudged a c
Roach to Forrest, no run pitched up, outside off, left by Forrest
Roach to Forrest, no run full length again, driven to cover
Roach to Forrest, no run forward and clipped to point
Roach to Forrest, OUT another one gone! Roach lures Forrest into a jab outside off, the bat well away from his body, and a thick edge is safely pouched by second slip
Bravo to Watson, FOUR runs loose ball, short and with room outside off for Watson to muscle the ball to the boundary between deep point and third man
Bravo to Watson, no run tighter line, defended into the on side
Bravo to Watson, 1 run width again but this time Watson cuts in front of point and the man in the deep fields
Bravo to Hussey, 1 wide down the leg side, Bravo losing his radar
Bravo to Hussey, 1 run angled across and dabbed to third man
Bravo to Watson, no run length, chopped to the fielder in the covers
Bravo to Watson, no run maintains a tighter line and Watson plays with a straight bat
Roach to Hussey, no run length, angled across the left-handed Hussey, defended on to the wicket
Roach to Hussey, no run bouncer, Hussey sways underneath
Roach to Hussey, no run on the stumps, length ball, prodded short on the off side
Roach to Hussey, no run length, defended to the bowler
Roach to Hussey, no run short of a length, played off the back foot to point
Roach to Hussey, no run beats the bat outside off - there's a sound but seems like it was bat against pad
Sammy to Watson, no run length, on off, defended
Sammy to Watson, 1 run on the legs, turned around the corner
Sammy to Hussey, 1 run slanted across and worked to third man
Sammy to Watson, no run length, defended to the leg side

Sammy to Watson, SIX runs shot! Sammy was a fraction short and Watson seized on it like a prizefighter spotting a gap in his opponent's guard, swinging an uppercut over the deep midwicket fence for a Dorothy
Sammy to Watson, 1 run driven square on the off side
Russell to Watson, no run tight line, played towards mid-on
Russell to Watson, no run back of a length, but too close to the body for Watson to cut, his shot dobbling to the fielder
Russell to Watson, 2 runs room to swing his arms again and Watson cuts past point
Russell to Watson, no run short and quick this time from Russell, causing Watson to drop his hands as the ball whistles through
Russell to Watson, no run on the stumps, defended
Russell to Watson, no run full, angled in and glanced hard but straight to midwicket
Sammy to Hussey, no run leg-stump line to the left-hander, turned to midwicket
Sammy to Hussey, 1 run full, flicked off the pads down to long leg
Sammy to Watson, no run slower, looping delivery, Watson leans into a push to cover
Sammy to Watson, 1 run room outside off and tickled past the dive of the man at short-third man
Sammy to Hussey, 1 run outside leg stump and punched for another single
Sammy to Watson, no run tempting length outside off and beats Watson's expansive drive past the inside edge
Russell to Hussey, no run touch short and the ball rears and seams further away from Hussey, who drops his hands and keeps out of the way
Russell to Hussey, 1 run fuller ball and driven square, one run pinched despite Pollard's diving stop in the gully
Russell to Watson, 1 run flicked off the pads to deep square
Russell to Hussey, no run full, on the stumps, driven to mid-off
Russell to Hussey, no run drops short, tucked square off his body
Russell to Hussey, no run length, Hussey pushes forward defensively, fielded by mid-off
Sammy to Watson, 1 run length, swinging away slightly and deflected down to third man
Sammy to Hussey, 1 run full ball, punched down the ground for one
Sammy to Watson, 1 run on the pads, clipped to deep backward square
Sammy to Hussey, no run slower ball on leg stump, Hussey brings his bat down on it
Sammy to Hussey, 1 run speared across and pushed behind point, playing back

Sammy to Watson, OUT Watson falls to the slower ball! Sammy rolled it out of the hand again - though it almost turned into a full toss - and Watson's clip flew off the toe of the bat to Devendra Bishoo, the substitute fielder, who took a low catch at midwicket
Russell to Hussey, 1 run down the leg side and pulled round the corner
Russell to Hussey, no run short ball and the batsman leans back out of the way
Russell to Hussey, no run length, on the stumps and half-driven towards mid-on
Russell to Hussey, no run full, on the stumps and defended
Russell to Hussey, no run length delivery, outside off but played to cover on the back foot
Russell to Hussey, no run pitched up, on the stumps again and defended
Sammy to Hussey, no run full, played into the leg side
Sammy to Hussey, 1 run cut hard, fielded on the bounce at point. Or was that a drop? Yes, it flew straight to Pollard but he couldn't hold on to it falling back
Sammy to Hussey, 1 run short of a length, played square off the back foot
Sammy to Hussey, no run defended on the back foot
Sammy to Hussey, 1 run tight line, guided from just outside off down to third man
Sammy to Hussey, no run full, defended via a pad
Russell to Hussey, 1 run played towards mid-on and they scramble a single
Russell to Hussey, 1 bye shoots through low outside off, just missing the stumps before spinning away off Baugh's legs
Russell to Hussey, 1 run length, rears up and Hussey drops it short for another dash
Russell to Hussey, 1 run outside off, goes back and drives through cover-point
Russell to Hussey, no run length, driven square where Pollard fields energetically
Russell to Hussey, 1 run outside leg and flipped off his hips by the batsman
Narine to Hussey, no run full off-break, Hussey lets it go past
Narine to Hussey, no run tossed up, spinning away again and Hussey tucks his bat behind his pad
Narine to Hussey, no run beautiful length, pitching around middle and turning past the outside edge as Hussey pushed forward uncertainly
Narine to Hussey, no run shorter, cut to the man at point
Narine to Hussey, no run flighted, Hussey goes back and leaves
Narine to Hussey, no run tossed up well outside off and turning further, Hussey missing with a swipe - so Narine starts with an impressive maiden
Russell to Hussey, FOUR runs short and wide, David Hussey cuts in the air over point for a one-bounce four
Russell to Hussey, no run tighter line, played back to the bowler
Russell to Hussey, no run played down the ground and David sends Michael back - just as well, as the throw at the non-striker's end was a direct hit
Russell to Hussey, no run played towards the man at cover
Russell to Hussey, no run full, worked off the pads to midwicket
Russell to Hussey, no run shorter but the cut shot comes off the bottom edge and bounces to cover
Narine to Hussey, 2 runs swept behind square for a couple
Narine to Hussey, no run tossed up outside off and left
Narine to Hussey, no run on the stumps, prodded back
Narine to Hussey, FOUR runs full, on off and Michael Hussey picks him up quickly to loft the ball over deep midwicket - lovely timing
Narine to Hussey, 1 run drops shorter, dabbed towards third man
Narine to Hussey, no run length, possibly a carrom ball and a leading edge drops short of the bowler
Pollard to Hussey, no run good length and straight, David Hussey blocks
Pollard to Hussey, no run played off the back foot towards gully
Pollard to Hussey, no run tight line and length, around middle, Michael Hussey blocks
Pollard to Hussey, no run the slower offbreak kicks off a good length and rises on Hussey, who sways and lets it go
Pollard to Hussey, no run he thought about pulling that one as it swerved away from him but let it go in the end
Pollard to Hussey, 1 run played off the pads behind square for a quick single, that was the only run in the over
Narine to Hussey, no run cut off the back foot to short third man
Narine to Hussey, 1 run Michael Hussey goes back and pushes the ball into the gap at point
Narine to Hussey, no run pushed through quick and straight, David Hussey defends on the leg side
Narine to Hussey, no run steered from the crease towards point, Narine's allowing no room
Narine to Hussey, no run defended on the front foot, that spun into the right-hander
Narine to Hussey, no run defended on the front foot once again, another one-run over
Pollard to Hussey, 1 run short of a length around off stump, cut off the back foot through point, the ball's not coming on to the bat off this pitch so he's just working the singles at the moment
Pollard to Hussey, 1 run short ball and it's been pulled towards the fielder to the deep square boundary
Pollard to Hussey, no run driven firmly off the front foot but Samuels dives to his left at extra cover to save runs
Pollard to Hussey, 1 run Bravo dives at point but can't prevent the single after the ball was cut towards him
Pollard to Hussey, 1 run far more singles in this Pollard over, this one is towards cover
Pollard to Hussey, no run good length outside off, played off the back foot towards backward point
Narine to Hussey, no run Narine spins the offbreak into the right-hand batsman, Hussey tries to turn it off his pads but doesn't make proper contact
Narine to Hussey, FOUR runs he's hit this one well, the one that spins the other way is a bit short outside off and Hussey uses the room to go back and cut hard through backward point
Narine to Hussey, 1 leg bye Hussey strides forward and outside the line of off stump to defend, the ball spun back into him and hit the pad

Narine to Hussey, OUT he's been caught behind! Narine bowled it quicker and pitched it fuller, Hussey came forward to drive and edged it as the ball spun across him. Baugh took a sharp catch. He had little reaction time.
Narine to Bailey, no run there's an appeal after the man at backward short leg catches the ball but it came off the pad as Bailey tried to defend
Narine to Bailey, no run fuller and wider outside off stump, Bailey drives firmly but the shot is blocked at short cover
Pollard to Hussey, 2 runs played through square leg off the front foot
Pollard to Hussey, 1 run pushed off the front foot to long-off
Pollard to Bailey, no run that one shoots through at shin height after pitching short of a length, Bailey tries to defend on the back foot and is beaten close to off stump
Pollard to Bailey, no run another one keeps low off a length that's a bit fuller, Bailey gets beaten once again
Pollard to Bailey, 1 run steered towards third man with an open face
Pollard to Hussey, 1 run short of a length angling into the right-hander, played with soft hands close on the off side
Samuels to Hussey, 1 run Hussey goes back and works the flat ball off his pads behind square
Samuels to Bailey, no run that's a long hop which spins into Bailey, he pulls but can't beat the man at square leg
Samuels to Bailey, no run played to square leg again, Hussey thinks about the single but has to hurry back
Samuels to Bailey, 1 run played behind square this time for a single
Samuels to Hussey, 1 leg bye glanced off the pads towards fine leg where Russell fields
Samuels to Bailey, FOUR runs that's too short again and Bailey pulls, this time beating the fielder at square leg by placing it behind him and to the boundary
Pollard to Hussey, 1 run good length but the line is too straight, glanced off the pads to fine leg
Pollard to Bailey, FOUR runs too full and wide outside off, Bailey has room to drive and he plays a flowing one, placing it through the gap at cover
Pollard to Bailey, 1 run glanced with an open face to third man
Pollard to Hussey, 1 run short of a length outside off, cut off the back foot, giving third man more work
Pollard to Bailey, 1 run Narine has to run again at third man after another one goes in his direction
Pollard to Hussey, no run short of a length but wide outside off, Hussey tries to pull, dragging it with the bottom of his bat to midwicket
Samuels to Bailey, 2 runs Bailey works the ball off his pads towards fine leg
Samuels to Bailey, 2 runs Bailey pushes forward and opens the face to steer the ball past short third man
Samuels to Bailey, no run defended on the front foot towards the off side
Samuels to Bailey, 1 run bowled flat and straight, the batsman goes back and punches to long-on
Samuels to Hussey, no run Hussey tries to cut off the back foot but mis-times the shot to the bowler
Samuels to Hussey, no run defended on the back foot, Samuels pushed that through quicker
Bravo to Bailey, no run length ball on off and middle, pushed towards mid-on but the fielder at midwicket cuts it off
Bravo to Bailey, no run defended from the crease to the man at midwicket
Bravo to Bailey, 1 run that's too full and on the pads, Bailey glances to Powell on the fine leg boundary
Bravo to Hussey, no run good length angling into off stump, Hussey gets behind the line and defends
Bravo to Hussey, 1 run the slower ball bowled on a fuller length, Hussey leans forward and flicks behind square
Bravo to Bailey, 1 run played off the back foot towards square once again, the length was good but the line a bit straight
Samuels to Bailey, no run played back to the bowler on the front foot

Samuels to Bailey, 1 wide that's wide down leg side, Baugh lunges to his left and flicks the ball back on to the stumps, Bailey had lost balance after trying to pull, but managed to keep his foot grounded
Samuels to Bailey, no run defended on the off side
Samuels to Bailey, 1 run Bailey moves forward and drives to long-on
Samuels to Hussey, 1 run flicked off the front foot through square leg
Samuels to Bailey, no run defended on the front foot to the bowler
Samuels to Bailey, 1 run Bailey's flicked that in the air but wide of the fielder diving to his right at midwicket

Bravo to Bailey, OUT caught at point! Bailey's cut the slower ball straight to the fielder. Bravo pitched it short of a length outside off and got the ball to bounce a bit more - tennis-ball type bounce
Bravo to Christian, 1 run a fuller and quicker ball angling into the right-hander, Christian comes forward to block but gets an inside edge behind square
Bravo to Hussey, no run length ball angling into off stump, Christian drives from his crease to point
Bravo to Hussey, FOUR runs that's a slower half-volley outside off, Hussey has room to free his arms and he swings hard off the front foot, launching it flat towards the long-off boundary
Bravo to Hussey, no run the short ball and Hussey sways out of the way
Bravo to Hussey, no run good length angling into off and middle, Hussey drives from his crease to extra cover
Samuels to Christian, no run Christian strides forward to block but misses, the ball hits his arm and then goes on to the pad
Samuels to Christian, 1 run pushed off the front foot towards cover point
Samuels to Hussey, no run Hussey moves forward and closes the face to play on the leg side, he too doesn't make contact
Samuels to Hussey, 1 run driven off the front foot towards long-on
Samuels to Christian, no run big turn into the right-hander, Christian tried to cut but was cramped for room
Samuels to Christian, 1 run played towards long-on off the front foot
Russell to Christian, no run good length around off and middle stump, defended on the leg side from the crease
Russell to Christian, no run length ball outside off stump, played off the front foot towards point
Russell to Christian, no run Christian tries to pull a ball that is too full and misses, getting hit high on the front pad
Russell to Christian, 1 run the slower ball cuts into the right-hander from outside off, Christian dabs on the off side and runs
Russell to Hussey, no run fuller length around off stump, Hussey drives to cover
Russell to Hussey, no run that's too full and too close to off stump for the late cut and Hussey was beaten
Narine to Christian, 1 run played towards mid-on off the front foot
Narine to Hussey, 1 leg bye lots of turn into the right-hander but the ball ends up on the pads, allowing the batsman to work it behind square
Narine to Christian, 1 run forced off the back foot towards long-on

Narine to Hussey, OUT Christian's been run out! Hussey worked the ball towards square and set off, then hesitated a little, and set off again. Roach was quick to reach the ball from short fine leg and threw to the keeper, who broke the stumps with Christian well out
Narine to Wade, no run defended on the front foot towards point, he's survived his first ball today
Narine to Wade, no run played off the back foot to short third man
Roach to Hussey, no run Roach fires the ball into the blockhole, Hussey whips it towards short fine leg
Roach to Hussey, no run a low full toss on off stump, Hussey backs away towards leg and hits it to cover
Roach to Hussey, FOUR runs the slower ball outside off, Hussey makes room to cut and hits it behind point, he waited a moment and then executed the shot superbly
Roach to Hussey, 1 run played to mid-off for a quick single
Roach to Wade, (no ball) another one nearly in the blockhole, Wade flicks it to square leg, Roach had over-stepped, though, so there's a free-hit coming up
Roach to Wade, 1 run the free-hit is also in the blockhole, Wade can only dig it out towards mid-off
Roach to Hussey, no run in the blockhole outside off stump, Hussey tries to play through point and is beaten
Narine to Wade, OUT Wade lunged on to the front foot and tried to slog sweep, top-edging the ball in the air to Roach at square leg
Narine to Hussey, no run played off the back foot to square leg
Narine to Hussey, OUT bowled him! Two in the over. Hussey went back to cut and the ball spun back into him, inducing the bottom edge on to the stumps
Narine to McKay, no run spooned in the air but short of the fielder at mid-off
Narine to McKay, no run that's a ripper, the ball that spins the other way, it drifted into the right-hander, pitched on middle and spun past off, a left-arm spinner would have been proud
Narine to McKay, 1 run played to point for a very quick single
Roach to Hussey, 2 runs full ball on the pads, flicked behind square
Roach to Hussey, 1 run Roach is looking for the yorker, not getting the length right, Hussey plays the ball from off stump towards mid-on
Roach to Wade, no run Roach hits the pads and appeals but that pitched outside leg stump, Wade moved across to play on the leg side and missed the glance
Roach to Wade, no run good length angling across the left-hand batsman, Wade pushes towards cover on the front foot
Roach to Wade, 1 run a full toss this time, easier for Wade to flick off his pads through square, Sammy chases and slides
Roach to Hussey, no run another full toss, but Hussey can only play it back to the bowler
Narine to Wade, 1 run full ball outside off, driven from the crease through cover
Narine to Hussey, no run played back to the bowler on the back foot
Narine to Hussey, 2 runs Hussey strides on to the front foot, gets down on one knee and sweeps with power, Charles runs to his right on the deep square leg boundary and dives to save the four
Narine to Hussey, no run defended on the back foot
Narine to Hussey, 1 run played off the front foot in front of square, Bravo sprints to his left and dives to field
Narine to Wade, no run defended on the front foot towards the bowler
Roach to McKay, 1 run short of a length angling into McKay, who played it awkwardly behind square
Roach to Lee, no run a full toss, Lee punches it towards his team-mate and the ball hits the non-striker
Roach to Lee, no run Lee backs away to make room and cut, getting a bottom edge past his stumps to the keeper
Roach to Lee, 3 runs short ball and Lee swings, pulling the ball with power to deep square leg, the throw is wide from Darren Bravo to the keeper and that allows the third
Roach to McKay, 2 runs McKay backs away and swings a full ball towards wide mid-on, Dwayne Bravo dives to his right and takes pace off the ball
Roach to McKay, 2 runs backs away and hits it with a flat bat over cover
Narine to Lee, SIX runs that's a huge hit! Lee's stepped out of his crease, got to the pitch of the ball, and lofted it far over the long-on boundary with a full and free swing of his bat

Narine to Lee, 2 runs will he be caught here? No. It's just out of the reach of Kieran Powell, who ran back from mid-off and dived full length. Lee had backed away and mis-timed the loft down the ground
Narine to Lee, 1 bye Lee backs away outside leg and then tries to hit through midwicket. He misses and the ball goes between body and leg stump and beats the keeper
Narine to McKay, OUT McKay's been stumped. He charged out of his crease and swung hard, the flat and quicker ball sped past the bat, and Baugh had an easy job to do
Narine to Doherty, no run Doherty aims for the slog down the ground and makes no contact

Narine to Doherty, no run Doherty moves forward and swings at the ball, he gets beaten by the turn away from him and Baugh whips off the bails. Has Doherty been stumped? No, the back foot was grounded. Narine finishes with 4 for 27

2.45 pm Australia have been restricted to 154 for 9 but West Indies will have to chase 158 according to the D-L method. They were dismissed for 140 in the first ODI on a similar pitch, but you'd have to say West Indies are favourites at this point. Only just. We'll be back

West Indies run of defeats against Australia in ODIs stands at 13 - unlucky and then some. Can they reset the clock with a win here? We're about to find out, with Kieran Powell and Johnson Powell out in the middle. Brett Lee will open the bowling for Australia ...

Lee to Powell, OUT that's an abysmal leave! Lee's first ball is straight, on a good length and Powell shoulders arms! He's stuck in his crease, smack bang in front and that's the easiest decision Gregory Brathwaite has ever had to make, I imagine. What a start - West
Lee to Samuels, no run short, rearing outside off and thumping into a gloved hand
Lee to Samuels, no run length and left by Samuels, shuffling across
Lee to Samuels, no run on the stumps, played back, patting the ball down short on the leg side
Lee to Samuels, no run back of a length, defended
Lee to Samuels, no run fuller, quicker, on off and defended, the batsman right behind it - though he's not too sure where the ball ended up
McKay to Charles, 1 run length, outside off and Charles tries to leave, the ball unintentionally thunking off the face of the bat and scooting down to third man
McKay to Samuels, no run comes forward and pushes a defensive shot into the off side
McKay to Samuels, 2 runs nagging length, nudged behind point for a couple
McKay to Samuels, no run good length, on the stumps and played down on to the wicket
McKay to Samuels, no run again defended on a length outside off, the bat scissoring down from point
McKay to Samuels, no run tight line and length from McKay, defended into the leg side
Lee to Charles, no run targeting the stumps, slightly short and worked towards midwicket
Lee to Charles, 1 run fuller, room to drive outside off and steals a single wide of mid-off
Lee to Samuels, no run stays back and defends
Lee to Samuels, 1 run fullish, played on the back foot down to third man
Lee to Charles, no run tight line, quick and straight, jabbed to point
Lee to Charles, no run full ball, angling in, driven to mid-on, unable to get much on the shot
McKay to Samuels, no run on the stumps, defended
McKay to Samuels, no run full ball, nudged down the ground
McKay to Samuels, no run width for Samuels, who smashes the ball towards point, where it's well fielded
McKay to Samuels, no run full length, Samuels steps outside off and leaves
McKay to Samuels, no run pitched up and driven square but can't beat Dan Christian at cover-point
McKay to Samuels, no run straighter, turned into the leg side and the batsmen change their minds about a run - maiden for McKay
Lee to Charles, no run yorker right on the stumps and Charles does well to slam his bat down on it
Lee to Charles, FOUR runs strays down the leg side and neatly flicked to the boundary by the batsman
Lee to Charles, 1 run angled towards leg again and Charles clips wristily, McKay's diving stop preventing another boundary
Lee to Samuels, FOUR runs full, leg-stump line and squeezed fine for four more - Lee's not really bowling to his field here
Lee to Samuels, 2 runs full, straight, tickled behind square leg again
Lee to Samuels, no run edged ... but the ball dies on its way through to Wade. Better line from Lee but that was a profitable over for West Indies
McKay to Charles, no run on the stumps, solid defensive
McKay to Charles, no run length, on off and straightening, defended with a straight bat
McKay to Charles, FOUR runs given room outside off to swing his arms and Charles hammers a drive over mid-off and away to the rope
McKay to Charles, no run fuller, driven hard square but can't beat the infield
McKay to Charles, no run in the corridor outside off and punched to cover
McKay to Charles, no run length ball, Charles nudges it to short extra-cover and again there's no run
Lee to Samuels, no run length, nudged into the on side
Lee to Samuels, 1 run back of a length, played from deep in the crease down to third man

Lee to Charles, 2 runs another big swing, the ball goes up, up up and away ... but where to? Johnson's top-edge flew to third man, where Xavier Doherty took a catch diving over the rope, then threw the ball back into play before landing - it'll go down as a dropped c
Lee to Charles, no run shorter ball, defended
Lee to Charles, no run pitched up, driven square
McKay to Samuels, no run length, on the stumps, played to midwicket
McKay to Samuels, no run angled towards leg and clipped to backward square
McKay to Samuels, no run tempting line and length, draws Samuels forward and beats the outside edge
McKay to Samuels, 1 run pitched up, turned round the corner to fine leg
McKay to Charles, no run full, played into the off side
McKay to Charles, no run length ball, driven back to the bowler
Watson to Samuels, no run on the stumps, defended
Watson to Samuels, 2 runs slightly full, on the pads and tucked square, the batsmen running hard for a couple
Watson to Samuels, no run outside off, leaps from a good length and played awkwardly down towards point
Watson to Samuels, no run length, deflected towards point and the batsman is sent back, scrambling to beat the fielder's throw
Watson to Samuels, 1 run fuller, deflected to third man
Watson to Charles, no run pitched on a length, outside off and jabbed to cover
Hussey to Samuels, 1 run full, on the stumps, driven through cover
Hussey to Charles, 1 run clipped off the legs towards deep midwicket
Hussey to Samuels, FOUR runs tossed up on leg stump and driven emphatically straight down the ground, beating the man running round from long-on
Hussey to Samuels, 1 run flatter, on the legs and tickled square
Hussey to Charles, 2 runs full, on the legs and swept fine, reeled in by the rope
Hussey to Charles, no run darted towards leg stump, turned into a gap in front of square
Watson to Samuels, no run tight line, defended in his crease on off stump

Watson to Samuels, OUT full ball ... yorked him! Looked like Watson might have rolled that out the back of the hand but Samuels played over the top of the ball and the bails pinged into the air as if popped from a toaster
Watson to Bravo, no run length, outside off and pushed towards cover
Watson to Bravo, no run fuller delivery, driven from just outside off, can't beat the infield
Watson to Bravo, FOUR runs that one gets through! Big backlift from Bravo and punched past the diving fielder in the covers, the ball racing away - super timing
Watson to Bravo, no run around the wicket and defended on the back foot
Hussey to Charles, no run length, on the stumps and patted back to the bowler
Hussey to Charles, no run quicker ball, outside off, beats an attempted cut
Hussey to Charles, no run on the stumps, defended on the leg side
Hussey to Charles, 1 run flighted, still bowling around the wicket, driven from in front of off down the ground
Hussey to Bravo, no run bit more air and defended to point
Hussey to Bravo, no run flatter, quicker, outside off and allowed to go through to the keeper
Watson to Charles, no run full ball, driven hard but collected smartly by cover-point
Watson to Charles, 1 run slower ball, on leg stump and ticked into the gap
Watson to Bravo, no run around the wicket to Bravo, full delivery, driven to mid-on
Watson to Bravo, no run tight line on off stump, scrambled seam - defended on the front foot

Watson to Bravo, no run terrible calling but somehow Charles survives! Bravo pushed to mid-on, called for the run then changed his mind, leaving Charles stranded - but the two Aussie fielders, one of them the bowler Watson, left it to each other to complete the stum
Watson to Bravo, no run defended towards the leg side

Hussey to Charles, 4 byes oooh! What happened there? Hussey turned one back through Charles, beating the bat, flying over the stumps, past the keeper and running away for byes. Hussey clasps his head in his hands!
Hussey to Charles, no run on the stumps, gets behind this one
Hussey to Charles, 1 run driven out through the cover area
Hussey to Bravo, no run short, played on the back foot to third man
Hussey to Bravo, 1 run fuller ball, driven out to deep backward point
Hussey to Charles, 1 wide down the leg side and misses with the sweep
Hussey to Charles, no run flat, defended on the stumps
Watson to Bravo, 1 wide slanted down the leg side - another extra to the West Indies total
Watson to Bravo, no run fuller, straighter, driven to long-on
Watson to Bravo, no run pitched up, driven into the ground back to the bowler
Watson to Bravo, no run full, defended on the stumps
Watson to Bravo, FOUR runs overpitched, Bravo swings heartily, smashing a laser-guided cover drive to the rope
Watson to Bravo, FOUR runs and again! Not such a sweet connection but the ball skitters aways quickly enough through extra cover
Watson to Bravo, 1 run on the legs and flicked away for a single
Christian to Bravo, no run Wade is up to the stumps, Bravo defends on the front foot
Christian to Bravo, 1 run touch shorter, room to cut through point
Christian to Charles, no run length ball, takes the pace off it, jabbed short on the leg side, off the splice
Christian to Charles, no run rears off a length, dropped into the leg side again
Christian to Bravo, no run around the wicket, pushed to mid-on
Doherty to Bravo, no run defended on the front foot
Doherty to Bravo, no run Doherty rips the ball past the outside edge of the forward defence
Doherty to Bravo, 1 run played off the pads towards square leg for a single
Doherty to Bravo, no run Darren thrusts forward to defend and gets bat and pad on the leg side
Doherty to Bravo, no run goes for the big cover drive but ends up hitting the ball on to the pad off the inside edge
Doherty to Bravo, no run comes forward to block but misses the ball and is hit on the pad by the turn into the left-hand batsman
Christian to Bravo, 1 run good length and straight, played from the crease behind square
Christian to Bravo, no run good length angling into the left-hander from round the wicket, defended from the crease
Christian to Bravo, 1 run Bravo drives away from his body and edges an outside edge to third man
Christian to Bravo, no run good length and straight, defended on the front foot
Christian to Bravo, 1 run punched off the back foot towards cover
Christian to Bravo, no run length ball outside off, Bravo plants his foot forward and has a real go, he wanted to blast that through the off side but was beaten instead, he's missed a few of those
Doherty to Bravo, no run defended on the front foot on the off side
Doherty to Bravo, 2 runs full ball on the pads, Dwayne Bravo moves forward and flicks along the ground to deep midwicket
Doherty to Bravo, 1 run tossed up from round the wicket into off and middle, driven through cover

Doherty to Bravo, OUT this was inevitable. Darren Bravo has been bowled off the inisde edge trying to drive the ball through cover. Doherty tossed the ball up outside off stump from round the wicket, drawing the batsmen into driving away from his body. Bravo reached
Doherty to Pollard, no run defended on the front foot to the man at silly point, a slightly deep silly point
Doherty to Pollard, 1 run played off the pads behind square, a little hesitation between the wickets
Christian to Pollard, no run good length and straight, defended from the crease
Christian to Pollard, no run played off the back foot towards point
Christian to Pollard, no run Pollard tries to play towards square but ends up pushing it towards the bowler
Christian to Pollard, no run Pollard stays on the back foot and pushes the ball in the air but well short of mid-off
Christian to Pollard, no run Pollard stays in his crease and blocks once again, towards the bowler
Christian to Pollard, SIX runs after five dot balls, Christian drops one short and Pollard is quick to capitalise, staying back and heaving the ball over the midwicket boundary
Doherty to Bravo, no run Doherty spins the ball sharply away from the right-hander after pitching outside off, Bravo lets it go
Doherty to Bravo, no run defended on the front foot
Doherty to Bravo, 1 run Bravo strides forward and pushes towards long off
Doherty to Pollard, no run Pollard strides forward to defend but gets beaten by the turn away from him
Doherty to Pollard, no run defended from the crease towards the off side
Doherty to Pollard, 1 run driven from the crease to long off for a single
Christian to Pollard, 1 run full and straight, flicked towards midwicket where the fielder fails to stop the ball with a dive
Christian to Bravo, 1 run clipped off the pads through square leg
Christian to Pollard, no run defended on the leg side
Christian to Pollard, no run good length on off stump, Pollard defends from his crease

Christian to Pollard, SIX runs that's pretty satisfying for West Indies. Pollard has room outside off to free his arms and he swings with a lot of power, lofting the length ball over the extra cover boundary
Christian to Pollard, 2 runs played towards square leg for a single
Doherty to Bravo, 1 run Bravo strides forward and defends as the ball spins across him from round the wicket, he plays towards short third man for a single
Doherty to Pollard, no run Pollard stays in his crease and dead-bats the ball on the off side
Doherty to Pollard, SIX runs Pollard carts Doherty back over his head for his third six, he didn't get to the pitch of the ball, but just smacked it as it turned across him
Doherty to Pollard, no run driven with power from the crease through the off side
Doherty to Pollard, 1 run Pollard plays the ball through square leg, off his pads
Doherty to Bravo, 1 run played off the back foot through cover
Christian to Bravo, 1 run steered from the crease towards third man
Christian to Pollard, no run defended from the crease on the off side
Christian to Pollard, 2 runs Pollard drives with so much power that the ball bursts through Watson at mid-off
Christian to Pollard, 1 run forced off the back foot through midwicket, there's a fielder in the deep
Christian to Bravo, no run good length and straight, Bravo defends after getting behind the line
Christian to Bravo, 1 run Bravo stays back and opens the face to run a length ball to third man
Lee to Bravo, 1 run played off the front foot with an open face towards third man
Lee to Pollard, 1 run a full toss on the pads, Pollard plays it to deep square leg
Lee to Bravo, no run good length on off stump, Bravo defends on the front foot
Lee to Bravo, 2 runs shot! Bravo's blazed a full ball through point with a square drive that's dripping with flair - a high back lift and a flowing follow-through of the bat
Lee to Bravo, 1 run played off the hips behind square
Lee to Pollard, no run short of a length outside off, the ball climbs on Pollard, who lets it go
McKay to Bravo, 1 run length ball on middle and leg, Bravo moves across his stumps and glances towards fine leg
McKay to Pollard, no run Pollard plays back to a length ball that nips into him and gets hit high on the pad
McKay to Pollard, 1 run length ball angling into the right-hander, Pollard plays from his crease and drives the ball through midwicket
McKay to Bravo, 2 runs short of a length outside off, Bravo cuts from his crease, placing it far enough towards third man's right to run the second

McKay to Bravo, no run a loud appeal for lbw but umpire Tarapore says not out. Australia have asked for a review. Bravo thrust forward while trying to defend and got hit on the knee roll by one that nipped back into the right-hander. The impact on the pad was outsid
McKay to Bravo, no run Bravo tries to cut a slower ball from a good length and is beaten
Lee to Pollard, no run short of a length and straight, Pollard defends on the leg side and wants one, Bravo did not because Bailey from midwicket had come sprinting in and dived
Lee to Pollard, no run full ball on middle stump, played towards Bailey at midwicket
Lee to Pollard, no run that is a well-directed bouncer, right at Pollard's head, the batsman ducks under it
Lee to Pollard, no run played off the back foot towards midwicket, Lee's keeping the length on the shorter side, not letting Pollard get underneath any
Lee to Pollard, 2 runs worked off the pads behind square and Pollard covers the pitch easily with long strides to return for the second
Lee to Pollard, no run another fast short ball that has Pollard ducking in a hurry to avoid wearing it on his helmet
McKay to Bravo, no run the slower ball on a good length outside off, Bravo comes forward and defends to cover
McKay to Bravo, no run good length and straight, Bravo moves towards the off to get behind the line and blocks
McKay to Bravo, no run Bravo thrusts his pad outside off stump and shoulders arms, the ball comes into the right-hander and hits the pad but it wasn't doing enough to hit off stump
McKay to Bravo, no run defended on the front foot towards midwicket
McKay to Bravo, 1 run the yorker, but Bravo manages to play it towards midwicket, the throw hits the stumps at the striker's end and they run an overthrow for the ricochet
McKay to Pollard, no run defended from the crease towards the bowler
Doherty to Bravo, no run Bravo strides forward and defends, there's a slip in place
Doherty to Bravo, 2 runs driven with power off the back foot towards the cover boundary, where a tandem effort saves the four
Doherty to Bravo, FOUR runs Bravo comes forward and lofts the ball towards the long-on boundary for a one-bounce four. That brings up the 50 run stand as well
Doherty to Bravo, no run defended on the front foot
Doherty to Bravo, no run cut off the back foot towards backward point
Doherty to Bravo, no run Bravo strides forward and blocks

McKay to Pollard, no run that nipped back sharply into the right-hander, hitting Pollard on the thigh pad, the ball bobbed up wide of off stump and Wade lunged for it, but I don't think there was any bat on that
McKay to Pollard, no run defended from the crease towards point
McKay to Pollard, no run that's slow and wide outside off stump, delivered from the back of the hand with an upright seam, the batsman chases it and drives, but gets beaten
McKay to Pollard, 1 run full and straight, swinging into the blockhole, dug out towards mid-on
McKay to Bravo, no run driven on the front foot towards cover
McKay to Bravo, 2 runs length ball on he pads, Bravo leans across and clips through midwicket
Doherty to Pollard, 1 run Pollard goes back and cuts hard in front of point
Doherty to Bravo, no run defended on the front foot on the off side
Doherty to Bravo, no run Bravo tries to defend on the front foot but gets beaten by the turn away from him
Doherty to Bravo, 1 run Bravo applauds after completing a very quick single, Pollard had responded immediately after Bravo pushed towards cover
Doherty to Bravo, no run defended on the off side
McKay to Pollard, no run cut off the back foot towards point, the keeper is standing up to the stumps
McKay to Pollard, no run another back of the hand slower ball outside off, Pollard lets it go this time, he had chased the previous one and was beaten
McKay to Pollard, no run Pollard tries to cut a length ball outside off and misses, Wade does not collect cleanly
McKay to Pollard, no run defended on the back foot towards the bowler
McKay to Pollard, no run defended from the crease on the leg side, wicket to wicket line on a good length from McKay
McKay to Pollard, no run Pollard tries to drive from his crease at one that's not full enough and gets beaten outside off stump
Doherty to Bravo, no run Bravo comes forward and blocks
Doherty to Bravo, no run Bravo goes for the expansive cover drive and gets beaten bu the turn away from him
Doherty to Bravo, no run left alone outside off stump as the ball spins away from him
Doherty to Bravo, 1 run driven through cover for a single

Doherty to Pollard, SIX runs that's a monstrous hit, it's out of the ground, the ball bounced on the roof and disappeared. Pollard cleared his front foot and swung hard, sending the ball far over midwicket, see you later. They need a new ball.
Doherty to Pollard, no run Pollard tries to blast down the ground but mis-hits it to midwicket
Watson to Bravo, no run good length and straight, Bravo gets behind the line and defends

Watson to Bravo, OUT Bravo's been run out! He pushed the ball close on the off side and set off immediately, Pollard did not respond because the ball was around the silly point area and Wade, who was standing up to the stumps, had got to it in a flash. By the time B
Watson to Baugh, no run defended on the front foot towards point
Watson to Baugh, no run good length outside off, Baugh lets it go
Watson to Baugh, no run good length and straight, defended on the back foot
Watson to Baugh, no run Baugh gets behind the line and defends
Lee to Pollard, no run short of a length and straight, defended from the crease on the leg side. Lee won't be giving Pollard too much in his half
Lee to Pollard, no run short of a length again, defended on the off side this time
Lee to Pollard, no run played watchfully towards cover from the crease once again, the length isn't full
Lee to Pollard, no run short of a length outside off, Pollard pushes to point and runs, and then screams for Baugh not to run, I don't think Baugh was going anywhere
Lee to Pollard, 1 run the attempted yorker ends up as a full toss on the pads, clipped towards deep square leg
Lee to Baugh, no run good length outside off, Baugh defends on the off side
Watson to Pollard, 1 run tight on the stumps, nudged on the leg side
Watson to Baugh, no run length, defended on the back foot
Watson to Baugh, no run slower ball with a scrambled seam, outside off and Baugh swishes and misses
Watson to Baugh, 1 run edged! But it bounces in front of the cordon and between slip and the keeper
Watson to Pollard, no run tight line, punched to cover
Watson to Pollard, 1 run room outside off to swing his arms and Pollard chops down to third man
Lee to Pollard, 1 run short, pulled from outside off to deep square leg, Pollard's bottom hand coming off the bat in the process of executing the shot
Lee to Baugh, no run length, outside off and Baugh stays back, pats towards point
Lee to Baugh, 1 run drops short and steered down to third man
Lee to Pollard, no run short ball, Pollard rides the bounce and though it clips the gloves the ball falls short of Wade
Lee to Pollard, 1 run clipped to deep backward square
Lee to Baugh, FOUR runs a crucial boundary? Lee dropps short again and Baugh hooks the ball over his shoulder and away for four
Watson to Pollard, 1 run length, poked out towards cover-point
Watson to Baugh, no run room outside off for Baugh to have a swing, which misses by a mile
Watson to Baugh, no run fuller delivery, dug out to mid-off
Watson to Baugh, 2 runs pitched up and swung over midwicket for a couple. Not a clean connection but he did enough to clear the infield
Watson to Baugh, no run hacked into the off side - and there's an appeal for a run out after a direct hit at the non-striker's end. Pollard was back though
Watson to Baugh, FOUR runs full ball and Baugh steps back, launching an expansive drive over cover - surely that's the clincher?
Doherty to Pollard, 1 run length, punched to long-off
Doherty to Baugh, SIX runs there she goes! Baugh swings a huge six over deep midwicket and West Indies have beaten Australia!
So, we now have a contest, with episode three scheduled for Tuesday; do join us again then. Bye!
West Indies won by 5 wickets (with 10 balls remaining) (D/L method)
Player of the match is Sunil Narine, WI
